intro: Ajania qiraica, commonly known as the Kashmiri ajania, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Pakistan. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers, which appear in late summer, are yellow with a central disc, making it a distinctive and ornamental species.
